newsitem.title: UK: BT confirms board meeting this weekend.
newsitem.headline: BT confirms board meeting this weekend.

text.p: British Telecommunications Plc confirmed on Saturday that its board was meeting this weekend to consider a possible strategic merger with MCI Communications Corp.
"The board is meeting over the weekend to consider an anticipated proposal from MCI," the spokesman said.
He would not be drawn on where the BT board meeting was taking place but said only that BT chief executive Sir Peter Bonfield was not in the United States.
The spokesman said an announcement was anticipated before the opening of the London stock market on Monday.
Sources close to the talks said an announcement was not expected on Saturday.
Both BT and MCI have said there are no assurances that an agreement will be entered into or that any transaction will be consummated.
Analysts are speculating that BT could pay $40 a share for the 80 percent of MCI it does not own -- leaving it with a total bill of $22.1 billion.
The deal would create the world's second largest telecoms group by market capitalisation -- just ahead of U.S. giant AT&T Corp but behind Japanese powerhouse NTT Data Corporation.
